ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic knowledge of Indonesian language and culture
I learned how to speak basic Indonesian. I can have a real conversation about everyday life.
Knowledge of Indonesian language and culture!

I started the semester off knowing zero Indonesian.  I now feel comfortable talking in Indonesian and can say many things.  One of my friends and I regularly talk to each other in Indonesian (we're in the same class) because we actually enjoy it.  The class is super fun and engaging.
Throughout the level 1 course, you develop a basic understanding of not only the Indonesian language, but you also grasp onto aspects if their culture as well.
Learned introductory indonesian
speaking another language and learning another culture
How to speak the basics of Indonesian language.
Not much work is assigned, so it is up to the student to review vocabulary.
Basic Indonesian language skills.
I not only learned the fundamentals of the Indonesian language, but I also learned a lot about Indonesian culture.
So much! All about the language and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Amazing professor and TA
Good pace of learning
This course could be improved by teaching more vocabulary. Because we have learned so much grammar, making the class more vocabulary-heavy would allow for more practice in Bahasa Indonesia.

Strengths: fun and interesting class! I enjoy coming to class and the language is very well taught. I learn a lot and the review sessions before tests are very helpful. Amazing prof and TAs. 
Weaknesses: Grading is uncertain, some assignments left ungraded
I think there are many strengths in that it goes at a good pace to allow students to learn a lot of information but not feel as if they are swamped by information.

Strength: Instructors are enthusiastic and have a passion for teaching. They make learning this wonderful language enjoyable, fun, and interactive.

Weakness: NONE
Great interactive course that effectively facilitates learning
good, not too much work given. weakness - to many tests at the end of the semester

Strengths: great tempo of course, had fun while learning, great learning environment

Weaknesses: sometimes did not know what exactly would he on tests

The course was interactive and easy to follow along. It did not follow the format of a traditional language course, but I found that by the end of the semester I knew more Indonesian that I was expecting.

Strengths are the welcoming and encouraging staff.
Weaknesses may include the lack of structure when teaching grammar.
The weaknesses are the lack of use of canvas. The strengths are that the course is super engaging.
NO weaknesses

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes definitely
I would recommend this class to another student. You will learn A LOT, and the faculty lineup is excellent.

YES! Focuses on culture AND language, which is great bc most language classes at Yale are very difficult and language intensive. Focusing on both allows for a very comfortable pace and helps you learn more. Very fun class, which is necessary since you have to go to class everyday. Pak Indriyo is awesome. Low workload and you'll do well as long as you show up and study for tests.

I would recommend this course to other students because I have a good time in the class.  The teachers make it fun and it is one of those classes that regardless of how tired you are you won't fall asleep.
Absolutely. A great course to fill the language requirement.
I would, you will learn alot and the instructors are fantastic
YES, lots of food and indonesian is a fun culture to learn about !!
Yes, great course
Yes, great course. Pak Indriyo is amazing and I had a great time.
Yes, it is a great introductory course for a new language.
Yes, I would recommend this course because the teachers engage with their students and I was always excited to go to class.
Yes!
